Summary: Witnessed an unaerodynamically shaped craft without lights fly silently into and out of view.
divs: sighting details[i originally submitted this report to mufon shortly after the event when it was freshest in my mind so as to maintain the clearest account for reference, but am unable to find it in your report database.] on saturday, 2\17\07, i exited the golf course where i play just after sunset. at that time of year, it would have been close to 5pm. as i drove out the exit road, i noted, when the road made a turn to nw, a strange silhouette approaching at speed from the southwest. i at first thougt it some type of raptor, like a red-tailed hawk, but the shape was not right and the course was too straight. it was unusual enough to continue to engage my full attention. i stopped the car and dropped the window while i continued to watch this strange-looking airborne object still in silhouette. i then quickly made a turn to the west at the intersection to improve my angle and stopped the car again to watch this object continue to approach from the sw. the object exhibited no strobe lights at all which are customary on domestic aircraft, and now at this new angle the object was no longer in silhouette and was much nearer now. i am not an engineer, but i know enough to recognize that the known laws of physics say this aircraft should not have been in the air. there was nothing aerodynamic about its shape at all. two metallic spheres were placed opposite the other behind the mid-point of the central section of the craft that i can only call the "fuselage". the spheres were a burnished copper color, with a black line running around their equators. from my viewing angle, the rear of craft was obscured by the spheres. the "fuselage" itself, as much as i could see of it, was shaped like a shuttlecraft as featured on the "star trek" series, with a downard sloping nose. i can only guess the altitude of it, not knowing its actual size, but i would estimate it at not more than 1500 feet. and it was totally silent as it passed just to the south of my vantage point...it made no noise at all, not even the rush of air being split. it then appeared to bank a little left, and disappeared out of sight over the hills and pines to the north behind me. the total time it engaged me was 2 to 3 minutes. i have never seen anything like it, before or since. i was breathlessly stunned and awed. i hurried home to call the pd and the newspaper to see if any reports witnessing this had been made, as the course the object was on would have taken it right over the main part of the city of redding. there were no other reports even though the craft was low and the sky was clear. i know what i saw and am still stunned by it.
trends: There have been 39 other sightings in Redding
